messages.message:
:dog: dogfood and UAT can be unstable this weekend for jenkins job update

we are going to make some major pipeline changes to dogfood and UAT deployment Jenkins script so we have a unified definition of all services we deploy and no longer have to update different groovy files when we add/change services (more detail in :thread:). We will be running some deployments on dogfood and UAT over the weekend to make sure things work fine and as a result dogfood and UAT may be unstable during this weekend, feel free to ping me or post in <#C035SLYCJ9X|> if you have questions or concerns.

technical detail: for aws infra all services deployment definition will come from Services.groovy (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/tools/releasetools/jenkins/pipelines/lib/Services.groovy) so add/remove/update services will all happen in this file
we will extend this to azure pipelines once we stabilize things on AWS side for 1-2 releases (22.06 and 22.07)
I was about to send a similar note.  Iâ€™m going to be reducing the overall nodes size as we are extremely overprovisioned right now.
